subject: Travel
title: Reinhold Messner: No Oxygen, No Excuses
description: A 60-second lesson on Reinhold Messner: No Oxygen, No Excuses.

hook.text: Doctors said climbing Everest without supplemental oxygen would cause brain damage or death.

buildup.text: In 1978, Reinhold Messner and Peter Habeler ignored the warnings and climbed without oxygen tanks.

discovery.text: Above 26,000 feet, they took one breath for every step. Messner hallucinated near the summit.

twist.text: Two years later, Messner went back and soloed Everest without oxygen â€” completely alone.

climax.text: He then climbed all fourteen 8,000-meter peaks, a feat no one had ever attempted.

punchline.text: He proved the limit was in the mind, not the lungs.

quiz.question: What did Reinhold Messner prove in 1978?
options: That Everest could be climbed in winter
That Everest could be climbed without oxygen
That Everest was taller than measured
